Subject: How compile cantera under Mandrake 10.0
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=205845264
X-Yahoo-Profile: wladimyrmd
X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 22 Nov 2004 09:05:52 -0000
X-eGroups-Remote-IP: 66.94.237.20



Dear Prof. Goodwin

Here below is attached the stdout of the (second) make command after
sucess. Tank you for your help and fast answer. It was true that the
package f2c was not installed. Following your advertising in the last
e-mail, I installed it and changed the "g2c"  to "f2c" in the library
reference in the setup.py file at Cantera/python directory. 

Another point is concerning about the Numeric and numarray library. In
the site "http://www.pfdubois.com/numpy/" which google found for me
using the search argument "python numeric", there is the following
remarke: "The older implementation, Numeric, is no longer supported
but will always be available". That's why I left the numarray package
installed and compile the cantera using it simply changing the
following line in the pycantera.cpp as shown below:
original:
#include "Numeric/arrayobject.h"
changed:
#include "numarray/arrayobject.h"

What do you think about? Is it better to use the original package ie.
Numeric?

The results of make command seems that it finished whitout error. Is
it true?

About how to use cantera under octave/scilab, where can I find a short
of cantera using matab example in order to test it using those
softwares (octave/scilab)?

Tank you for your attention and help

Wladimyr
